$Biandrate.comment_daniel: I believe that letters ms278_138 & ms278_139 concern the return from France of the Prince of Carignone, Carlo Alberto di Savoia, in 1821, possibly together with the count of d'Argentau (possibly François de Mercy-Argentau, who was governor of Brabant and chamberlain to the Dutch king). It is unclear why Biandrate was involved in this, but he fits the picture as he was connected to most of the greater political figures relevant in the 1921 Piedmontese revolution. There is little doubt that he was the count of Biandrate, as it is recorded that the previous count had no sons of his own.

$Bouquie.comment_daniel: Bouquié was een Belgische familie die zich uiteindelijk te Eibergen vestigde, waar Jean Baptiste Paul (de vader van onze Bouquié) een textielfabriek oprichtte. Volgens Te Vaarwerk was ofwel Jean Baptiste Paul ofwel Armand zelf een belangrijk informant van de koning van NL over de ontwikkelingen in België, vlak na de scheiding. Hij specifieert ook dat Armand in 1840 naar Frankrijk vertrok, wat verklaart waarom hij als titel 'fournissuer d'armée Française krijgt'.

$CanitzIA.comment_daniel: (Comment Sigrid: Canitz was in elk geval in 1845 ook al gezant in Rome, zie annuario pontificio van dat jaar. Hij komt dan ook voor in het archief, zie ms291). Ik vind het erg onwaarschijnlijk dat er een “de Canitz” zaakgelastigde van Nederland was zoals vermeld wordt in archief: 1) in de periode van vermelding was er een Canitz zaakgelastigde van Pruissen, 2) wordt er een von Canitz kamerheer van Pruissen genoemd in het archief, 3) is Liedekerke gezant van Nederland. Dit lijkt dus de zoon van bovengenoemde die inderdaad gezant was.

$Conti.comment_daniel: Impossible to determine who this is without more information from archive. Comment Sigrid: it's tempting to say that she is the sister of mathemetician Paolo Gorini: i her letter she makes an appeal on behalf of her brother, Gemello Gorini, and mentions that his father is Giovanni Gorini and that he is a professor of maths and sciences at Pavia Uni, which is true also of Paolo G.; she also says she's acted as a mother to her brother Gemello after both their parents passed away (also true, Paolo G. was orphaned at 12). However, and this is strange, there is no mention of Paolo having a sister and an extra brother (Gemello) anywhere, but I mean ANYWHERE. According to the letter this Gemello got his degree in medicin, and she's asking for a recommendation for him with the governror of the East Indies. I cannot find the relation with Paolo Gorini at all.
$Conti.name: Madeleine
